title: Firefox no longer suggests adresses
content:
Usually, when I start typing the address of a website I visit frequently, Firefox will suggest the complete address. Now, for the last week or so, it doesn't. For example, if I start typing guardian.com, the default is to search, and then only when I type the final "m" does it switch to "visit" when I press enter.

In settings, under Search, and Address bar, the box to suggest browsing history is checked, and at abount:config, browser.urlbar.autofill is set to true.

I have Firefox version 141.0.3
creator: tor.nordam

title: Fire fox loosing fox in Windows 11
content:
Just a note that I had a lot of probem with the firefox not opening when a link is being clicked. It would open in background but not come to focus.

External hyperlinks do not open in Firefox window.

I found that focusmanager.testmode was the cuplrit, after a lot of hard work.

title: Question About Newtab@mozilla.org.xpi
content:
Hello Mozilla Support Team,

I recently noticed a file named Newtab@mozilla.org.xpi on my system and wanted to confirm its purpose. My Firefox browser is working normally, and I have not observed any suspicious behavior, but I want to make sure this file is legitimate and part of Firefox’s features.

Could you please clarify if this file is a standard component of Firefox, especially related to the new tab page functionality?

Thank you for your help!

Best regards.

title: tab group does not collapse
content:
The release notes for 142.0 say: 

  Keep an active tab visible in a collapsed tab group   Focus on just one tab in a group without the clutter. Your active tab stays in view, keeping   things tidy even with the group collapsed.

But it does not define what an "active tab" is. I usually have a group which never collapses, it always has one or more tabs visible no matter what I do. Is this a bug? Or is there some way to stop tabs from being 'active'?
creator: MartinThomas

title: New way to remove the List all Tabs Button?
content: I just updated to Firefox 142.0.1, and the list all tabs button has returned. I tried the old fix by going into about:config and setting the browser.tabs.tabmanager.enabled = false as I was originally shown, but it doesn't seem to work. I don't know why, as it seemed to be fine the last few versions. I did recently sync my browser with another one on a windows 11 machine (which I suspect I'll be returning soon, as I prefer windows 10 to windows 11), but I can't imagine that being the reason, I don't think. Can anyone help figure out how to turn this thing back off?

title: i took my laptop in for keyboard issues after microsoft bios update they deactivated my network and my mozilla pin on passwords how do i turn my security pin back on in password security
content:
i took my laptop into ubreakifix for inactive keyboard issue, after 3 updates one being Microsoft bios update. the ubreakifix got the keyboard recognizing fingers again yet had deactivated my wifi network abilities to get online. i went through several restores until i have both working now.

My biggest concern is my Mozilla PIN on security & passwords has been deactivated, along with Microsoft syncs of pin requirements. Im still finding personal settings that have been changed without my permission. how do i get my security back up to par with Nightly and Mozilla protections all activated?

I also keep getting this bit defender popup on all reboots.
creator: thangamajog

title: Sudden Change of Appearance
content: Moments ago I rebooted my computer after a long day of heavy use (it's old). After rebooting and opening my Firebox Browser, I noticed all my Bookmarks were gone. I created a Firefox Bookmarks Export file on another desktop computer using a thumb drive and plugged it into my current desktop computer, and imported the Bookmarks. Great. They all seem to be there again. But the entire appearance of all the websites I regularly use have changed. I use Google Calendar and all the colors are gone. On my other computer, all the different tasks I've created still retain their colors with white lettering, but on this latest version of Ubuntu machine after the reboot, all by tasks are plain white with Black lettering. I compared the settings for Appearance on my two different computers and they are exactly the same. I couldn't Login to X on this machine after doing so numerous times, and after I logged into Bluesky, the appearance was completely different. I don't know what happened. The two attached screen grabs show the difference between this computer and my other one which still shows the color combinations that I want back within Google Calendar. Any idea what went wrong? Also, I tried to click the checkbox below that says, "Email me when someone answers the thread," and I could not. It wouldn't accept the check mark.
creator: wjgreen

title: Alle geopende tabbladen/vensters verdwenen, net als de geschiedenis in FF. Hoe terug te halen.
content:
Hallo,

Ik had altijd diverse vensters en tabbladen open staan. Die openden telkens via Ctrl-shift-N opnieuw. Ook oude tabbladen die ik al pakweg 2 maanden niet meer geopend had, kwamen probleemloos mee terug via deze toetsencombinaties.

Maar nu heeft firefox eigenhandig die allemaal gewist, alsook mijn hele geschiedenis.

Een zoekactie via google levert niks op, tenzij logische reacties zoals ze terughalen via Ctrl-shift-N of Ctrl-shift-T. Maar gezien mijn geschiedenis gewist is, helpt dit niet.

De zoekacties verwijzen precies naar het bestand "places.sqlite". Maar ik niet hoe dit te importeren of te openen.

Mijn bookmarks heb ik wel nog allemaal, maar zijn verouderd. Omdat bovenstaand systeem goed werkte - tot nu :-(

In welk bestand houdt firefox alle tabbladen van de recent gesloten vensters bij? En is dit terug te herstellen in mijn huidige browsessie?

Mijn huidige browser is Versie 140.2.0esr (64-bits)

Alvast bedankt!
creator: JimmySteele

title: Tabs constantly crashing.
content:
I've done all the troubleshooting I could find, including: Uninstalling, tried using beta ff, disabled hardware acceleration, disabled/removed all extensions, memtest, updated various drivers. Still frequent tab crashes Tried two other browsers and neither of those had any issues. No crashing on edge or duckduck.

Crash reason seem to be mostly EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ and EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT

Few crashes from today: https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/repor.../647f9599-8e18-417d-852e-b52300250827 https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/repor.../2001d7f1-4cfc-476b-9a88-4679a0250827 https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/repor.../b2101bae-a1cc-404c-b0d2-7b8230250827 https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/repor.../dede8925-55e3-484e-b2ab-3863d0250827
creator: lanceacarlisle
